definition: warm/lukewarm/temperature/to warm up/mild/soft/tender/to review (a lesson etc)/fever (TCM)/old variant of 瘟[wen1]
to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive

sentences.english: While you begin to Ti unexpectedly gentle pledged to do violence eccentric and unreasonable later become disobedient.
sentences.chinese: 雖然你開始信誓旦旦溫存倜儻，可後來變得忤戾乖張。

sentences.english: Evening was unfolding over the head of Jean Valjean all the sweetness of the infinite.
sentences.chinese: 夜把無極的一切溫存撒在冉阿讓的頭上。

sentences.english: Youll remember the sweetness of our caresses.
sentences.chinese: 你又想起那撫愛的溫存。

sentences.english: He was all gentleness to her.
How much tenderness may stay, and how much sentimental attachment may accompany?
sentences.chinese: 有多少溫存可以常留，有多少依戀能夠相隨？

sentences.english: The smell lingered, gentle mood of your stomach tenderness.
sentences.chinese: 徘徊不去的餘香，溫存心情也溫存你的胃。

sentences.english: The earliest account of Swain's existence comes from a Noxian infirmary doctor's notes.
sentences.chinese: 最早有關斯溫存在的記錄是出自洛克西斯的醫生手記。

sentences.english: They also had no fears about being openly tender and romantic.
sentences.chinese: 他們也不懼怕在公共場合溫存和浪漫。

sentences.english: Being captivated by shadow, how many people have betrayed divinity and warmness?
sentences.chinese: 被陰影魅惑，有多少人背棄了神性與溫存？

sentences.english: Former greetings silent in sik like the plague, even the attentive all no longer thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 昔日的問候無聲的挽惜像瘟疫，連溫存都不再徹底。

sentences.english: I was swimming soul, full avenue for the migration of finding that warm memories.
sentences.chinese: 我是遊魂，滿大街的遊走只爲找到那溫存的影象。

sentences.english: I prefer having your accompanying for life-long time to the  short-time tenderness.
sentences.chinese: 我不要短暫的溫存，只要你一世的陪伴。
